刻.definition: quarter (hour); moment; to carve; to engrave; to cut; oppressive; classifier for short time intervals

刻不容緩.definition: to brook no delay; to demand immediate action

刻印.definition: to engrave a seal; stamp mark; to print with carved type; to leave a deep impression

刻奇.definition: (loanword) kitsch, in a sense that originates in the writing of Milan Kundera: getting emotional about sth due to the influence of social conditioning

刻意為之.definition: to make a conscious effort; to do something deliberately

刻板.definition: stiff; inflexible; mechanical; stubborn; to cut blocks for printing

刻絲.definition: variant of 緙絲|缂丝[ke4 si1]

刻舟求劍.definition: lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances

刻苦耐勞.definition: to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering; hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity

刻薄.definition: unkind; harsh; cutting; mean; acrimony; to embezzle by making illegal deductions

刻錄.definition: to record on a CD or DVD; to burn a disc

刻骨銘心.definition: lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom); fig. etched in one's memory; unforgettable

刻鵠類鶩.definition: to aim to carve a swan and get a semblance of a duck (idiom); to fail utterly in trying to copy something; to get a reasonably good, if not perfect, result
